TextView.android:text: Sit comfortably with a straight spine and close your eyes. Take a deep breath in, then exhale forcefully through your nose by contracting your abdomen. The inhalation should be passive and natural. Repeat this process rapidly in a rhythmic manner, focusing on the forceful exhalations. Start with a few rounds and gradually increase the duration as you build stamina.

Kapalabhati helps in clearing the mind, energizing the body, and improving respiratory function. Avoid this practice if you have high blood pressure, heart conditions, or are pregnant. Always practice under the guidance of a qualified instructor.

Improves respiratory health: Kapalabhati Pranayama helps in clearing the respiratory passages, removing excess mucus, and increasing lung capacity, thereby enhancing overall respiratory health.
Boosts energy levels: The rapid and forceful exhalations in Kapalabhati Pranayama help in oxygenating the body and stimulating the nervous system, leading to increased energy levels and vitality.
Detoxifies the body: The vigorous exhalations in Kapalabhati Pranayama help in eliminating toxins from the body, cleansing the internal organs, and improving the functioning of the digestive system.
Improves mental clarity: Kapalabhati Pranayama enhances blood circulation to the brain, improving concentration, focus, and mental clarity. It also helps in reducing stress, anxiety, and depression.

Stimulates abdominal organs: The rhythmic contractions of the abdominal muscles in Kapalabhati Pranayama massage the internal organs, including the liver, pancreas, and spleen, promoting their optimal functioning.
Promotes weight loss: Regular practice of Kapalabhati Pranayama can aid in weight management by boosting metabolism, burning calories, and reducing abdominal fat.
Increases lung capacity: Kapalabhati Pranayama strengthens the respiratory muscles and expands lung capacity, leading to improved oxygen intake and better endurance during physical activities.

Be consistent: Practice Kapalabhati Pranayama regularly for optimal benefits. Aim for 3-5 rounds of 20-30 breaths per round, gradually increasing the duration over time.
Stay aware: Maintain mindfulness throughout the practice. Notice any sensations, thoughts, or emotions that arise without judgment.
